title: Trump Adds His Voice to Republicans Condemning ESG Investing
description: Donald Trump is seizing on growing objections among Republicans to investments based on environmental, social and governance principles, with a campaign video posted Friday opposing so-called ESG strategies.

title: Pence Draws Contrast With Trump as He Defends US Aid for Ukraine
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence gave a full-throated defense of assistance to Ukraine and criticized those in his party who have praised Russian President Vladimir Putin, exposing a fault line in the emerging 2024 Republican race between traditional GOP hawks and those skeptical of US support for Kyiv.

title: Trump Supporter in Georgia Seeks to Quiet Grand Jurors After Uproar
description: A Georgia lawmaker has proposed legislation that would effectively bar the type of news media interviews given this week by the foreperson of a special grand jury that investigated Donald Trump’s efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

title: Biden Defends Ohio Train Wreck Response, Not Planning Visit
description: President Joe Biden said he has no plans right now to visit the site of a disastrous train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio, that left residents worried about contaminated air and water.

title: Morgan Stanley Says Trading Probes Are Scrutinizing Information Sharing
description: Morgan Stanley disclosed more detail about the probes into its trading business by US regulators that are examining the sales of large blocks of stock.

title: House Republicans Probe Buttigieg Response to Ohio Train Crash
description: House Republicans are probing the Transportation Department’s handling of the Norfolk Southern Corp. chemical train derailment earlier this month that released a toxic soup of chemicals in East Palestine, Ohio.

title: EU Hits Russia With More Sanctions One Year After Invasion
description: European Union member states backed a 10th package of sanctions on Russia including tighter export restrictions and technology controls, as well as requiring banks to report information on Russian Central Bank and other sanctioned assets they hold.

title: Louisiana Opts to Auction Bonds to Avoid GOP Anti-ESG Quandary
description: Officials in Louisiana couldn’t agree on which Wall Street banks align closely enough to the state’s Republican politics to underwrite an upcoming bond sale — so they decided to put the debt up for auction instead.

title: Blinken Aims to Pressure Russia on Trip to Central Asia, India
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is traveling into Russia’s sphere of influence next week as he tries to pull some of Moscow’s traditional partners closer to the US position on the war in Ukraine.

title: US Treasury to Target ‘Dual-Use’ Products Headed for Russia
description: The Biden administration, in an effort to tighten its enforcement of sanctions against Moscow, will put more emphasis on blocking countries and companies around the world from sending Russia products and technology that could be repurposed for military use, the Treasury’s No. 2 official said.

title: Ex-ASML Employee Accused of Data Theft Is Being Probed for Ties to China
description: Investigators are looking at potential ties between the Chinese government and an ex-employee accused of stealing data from ASML Holding NV — a company critical to producing the world’s most advanced computer chips.

title: Russia Sold Oil Far Above Price Cap, Researchers Say
description: Russian companies got far more money from selling the country’s oil than previously thought in the weeks that followed the imposition of a price cap on the nation’s exports, a group of academics said.

title: Arming Ukraine Hasn’t Slowed Flow of Weapons to Taiwan, US Says
description: The push to funnel increasingly advanced weapons to Ukraine hasn’t interfered with the US’s long-standing policy of arming Taiwan against threats from China, a top State Department official said on Friday.

title: UN Security Council Meeting on Ukraine Devolves Into Squabbling
description: A UN Security Council meeting on Ukraine devolved into diplomatic squabbling from the very start on Friday, with Russia’s ambassador objecting to the order of speakers and disrupting a minute of silence for Ukrainian victims of the conflict.

title: Brexit Deal Hopes Rise With Sunak Set for Weekend Crunch Talks
description: Rishi Sunak is planning talks in the coming days with UK ministers, EU officials and Northern Ireland’s Democratic Unionist Party as the prospect grows for an end to the long-running standoff over Brexit, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Germany to Send More Leopard-2 Tanks to Ukraine Than Planned
description: Germany will send 18 Leopard-2 main battle tanks to Ukraine, four more than initially planned, the country’s defense ministry said on Friday.

title: Ghana’s Ex-Leader Seeks Party’s Backing to Run for President
description: Former Ghanaian President John Dramani Mahama is seeking nomination from his party to run as its presidential candidate in elections scheduled for next year.

title: Hamptons, NYC Homes Owned by Russian Oligarch Vekselberg Targeted for US Seizure
description: The US is seeking to seize six luxury properties in New York and Florida, valued at $75 million, tied to oligarch Viktor Vekselberg as it continues to pursue assets of wealthy Russians a year after Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Peru Is Running Out of Space to Keep its Jailed Ex-Presidents
description: A Peruvian prison built specifically to host disgraced former presidents will soon run out of space if former leader Alejandro Toledo is extradited from the US as expected.

title: He's Defended Cardi B and Migos. His Next Client Is Donald Trump
description: The #BillionDollarLawyer Drew Findling will defend the former president if he’s indicted

title: Sweden, Germany Pledge Almost 30 Tanks to Arm Ukraine Battalion
description: Sweden will send a batch of main battle tanks to Ukraine in a move set to help European countries fulfill their pledges and shore up the country’s ability to fight back against Russian attacks.

title: Mexican States Woo Tesla as AMLO Makes His Own Pitch
description: Ever since Elon Musk flew to Mexico to visit the northern state of Nuevo Leon in October, rumors have swirled about where Tesla Inc. will end up building its plant — and whether another state might snatch away the investment.

title: UK Will Not Sign Off Protocol Deal Until All DUP Concerns Addressed, Says Cleverly
description: Ministers will not sign off on a deal over Northern Ireland's post-Brexit trading arrangements without the backing of the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP), the Foreign Secretary has suggested.

title: Goldman Sachs Discloses Expanded Probe Into Its Credit-Card Business
description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. said that investigations and inquiries into its credit-card business has expanded beyond the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to include other government agencies.

title: Yellen Warns China That Helping Russia Will Bring Serious Consequences
description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen warned China and other nations against providing material support to Russia, saying any such actions would amount to an evasion of sanctions and would “provoke very serious consequences.”

title: Nigerian Lawmaker Arrested With Nearly $500,000 Ahead of Vote
description: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) — Police in Nigeria arrested a lawmaker who allegedly was carrying nearly $500,000 in cash in a battleground state a day before the country's presidential and parliamentary elections, raising fresh concerns Friday about the influence of money in the vote.

title: Race to Replace Scottish Leader Tightens as Nominations Close
description: The race to succeed Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon tightened after a week of wrangling over LGBTQ rights, the health service and where to go next in the push to break away from the rest of the UK.

title: UK Told to ‘Raise Game’ on Green Finance or Risk Falling Behind EU and US
description: The UK needs to advance its green finance agenda or risk falling behind as rivals pursue ambitious regulatory and subsidy programs, according to an expert panel advising the government.

title: France Will Oppose Any G-20 Statement Not Condemning Russian War
description: France is insisting that the Group of 20 finance chiefs find “strong” words to condemn Russia’s war in Ukraine, according to Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire.

title: Sri Lanka Suspends Local Government Polls for Want of Money
description: Sri Lanka will not hold local government polls scheduled for March 9 due to a lack of funds, the island’s Election Commission said in a statement.

title: What We Know About the Shadow Fleet Handling Putin’s Oil
description: Has a “shadow fleet” of oil tankers been amassed to help Russia evade sanctions and price caps on its energy exports? That’s the belief of a growing number of observers in the oil trading community who have been tracking mysterious purchases of hundreds of old tankers by undisclosed buyers and other signs of suspicious activity. In addition to weakening the sanctions, the growth of this shadow fleet could drive up shipping costs in general, they say.

title: 'One Year of War' Full Show 02/24/23
description:
Bloomberg TV marks one year of Russia's invasion of Ukraine with correspondents bringing ground reports from the epicentre and highlighting the human and economic cost of this unending war. We also hear from top Ukrainian business leaders, including chief executives from Naftogaz, Ukraine's biggest oil and gas company, and Kernel, the world's largest exporter of sunflower oil. 

 (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Mexico’s Economy Grows More Than Forecast Amid Weakening Trend
description: Latin America’s second-largest economy grew 3.1% in 2022, faces headwinds ahead

title: Junior Doctors in England to Strike for Three Days in March
description: Junior doctors in England are to strike for three days next month in the increasingly bitter dispute over pay, it has been announced.

title: US Navy Contractors Need to Speed Deliveries of Missiles to Counter China, Admiral Says
description: Some of the US Navy’s leading contractors need to speed their deliveries of crucial munitions, including torpedoes and the service’s top air-defense missile, to be ready for a potential conflict with China, according to the service’s chief for fleet readiness.

title: South African Minister Gordhan Labels Ex-Eskom CEO a Green Globetrotter
description: The South African minister who oversees state power utility Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. accused its former Chief Executive Officer Andre de Ruyter of spending too much time promoting a transition to green energy and paying inadequate attention to fixing its broken coal-burning plants.

title: India Spotted Flying Object Over Strategic Island Chain in 2022
description: About a year ago, locals on a strategic Indian island chain that sits closer to Singapore than New Delhi spotted an unusual object in the sky: a giant balloon similar to the one the US downed earlier this month.

title: Financial Watchdog Puts South Africa, Nigeria on Dirty-Money Gray List
description: South Africa has been placed on a global financial watchdog’s so-called gray list denoting nations with shortcomings in tackling illicit financial flows, a move that scars the country’s international reputation and may raise costs for banks and asset managers.

title: UK Doubles Visas for Residence Despite Aim to Cut Migration
description: The UK granted residence visas last year at almost double the pace it did before the pandemic as more people came to work and study in the UK.

title: Klitschko: Putin Needs Ukraine, But Doesn’t Need Ukrainians
description: Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko discusses Vladimir Putin’s motives as the Russian President’s invasion of Ukraine, the largest land war in Europe since WW2, reached the one-year mark. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Land Borders Closed, Banks Shut Ahead of Nigerian Elections
description: Nigeria ordered its land borders shut ahead of presidential elections on Saturday in Africa’s biggest democracy.

title: Singapore Fertility Rate Falls to Lowest on Record at 1.05
description: Singapore’s fertility rate fell to 1.05 babies per woman last year, the lowest on record based on data from the country’s Department of Statistics dating back more than six decades.

title: Political Leaders to Meet PSNI Chief After Shooting of Officer
description: Political leaders in Northern Ireland will meet the Police Service of Northern Ireland's Chief Constable later in the aftermath of the shooting of a police officer in Co Tyrone.

title: G-7 Sanctions Will Target Key Industries Aiding Russia’s War
description: The US and other Group of Seven nations will impose new export controls and a fresh round of sanctions on Russia, a year after President Vladimir Putin invaded Ukraine, the White House said.

title: Thailand Seeks to Partner TikTok, Facebook to Help Combat Fake News Ahead of Elections
description: Thailand plans to counter the menace of fake news and disinformation campaign ahead of national polls slated for May in partnership with popular platforms such as TikTok and Facebook.

title: China Dismisses US Claim Over Possible Weapons Sales to Russia
description: China pushed back on US accusations that it has considered providing lethal aid to Russia in its war in Ukraine, saying it never sells arms to parties involved in a conflict.

title: South Africa Will Be Added to Watchdog Gray List, Tax Chief Says
description: South Africa will be added to a global watchdog’s list of nations that have failed to adequately tackle illicit financial flows, the head of the nation’s tax agency said.

title: Poland to Deliver First Leopard Tanks to Ukraine on Friday
description: Poland is sending Leopard 2 battle tanks to Ukraine on Friday, the first of 14 vehicles the government has promised, according to an official who declined to be named.

title: Malaysia’s Anwar Expects Growth to Exceed 4.5% This Year
description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim is confident the economy will expand faster than expected in the current year, he said in a budget speech to parliament on Friday.

title: Ukraine: Report From Kyiv One Year After Russia's Invasion
description: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has reached the one-year mark with no clear end in sight. Oliver Crook reports from Kyiv for Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Vietnam Communist Party to Nominate New President Next Week
description: The top brass of Vietnam’s Communist Party will gather next week to nominate a new president following the abrupt resignation of Nguyen Xuan Phuc last month over revelations of widespread graft during his time as prime minister, according to multiple people familiar with the plans.

title: Anwar Seeks to Tax Vanity to Keep Malaysia Fiscally Sound
description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim unveiled a revised 2023 budget that proposes to tax vanity spending and use the funds to protect livelihoods, as part of a wider move to narrow the government’s budget deficit.

title: Ukraine Latest: War Reaches One-Year Mark With No End in Sight
description: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine reached the one-year mark with no clear end in sight. As the United Nations General Assembly passed a nonbinding resolution calling on Moscow to end its war, China and Brazil offered dueling peace plans, neither of which is likely to gain traction.

title: This Is China’s 12-Point Blueprint for Bringing Peace to Ukraine
description: China’s Foreign Ministry published a 12-point position paper on Friday laying out how it thinks peace can be restored to Ukraine.

title: Erdogan Spokesman Says Turkey Inclined to Hold Elections in May
description: Turkey is leaning toward holding general elections in May as planned unless political consultations suggest otherwise following this month’s devastating earthquakes, a spokesman for Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said.

title: US Likely to Put a Tech Cap on South Korean Chipmaking in China
description: The US is likely to impose a limit on the chip production capabilities of Samsung Electronics Co. and SK Hynix Inc. in China, a senior American official said, as Washington works with allies to curb Beijing’s access to cutting-edge technologies.

title: Gulf States Play Hardball Over Sending Billions to Rescue Egypt
description: Gulf countries are waiting for more certainty on Egypt’s currency and proof it’s making deep economic reforms before unleashing billions of dollars of crucial investment.

title: South Africa’s Eskom Appoints CFO Calib Cassim as Interim CEO
description: South Africa’s state power utility appointed Chief Financial Officer Calib Cassim as interim chief executive officer, two days after the early departure of the company’s former boss.

title: Taiwan Plays Down US Troop Presence as Pentagon Boosts Support
description: Taiwan has emphasized there are no US troops “stationed” on the island after the Pentagon said it planned to increase its presence there, the latest sign of Washington’s willingness to raise the ire of China.

title: How Biden’s Shock-and-Awe Tactic Is Failing to Stop Russia
description: The economic punishment of Russia was touted as a game-changer. Instead it’s turned into a war of attrition — and a race against time.

title: Six Charts Show the Challenges Facing Nigeria’s Next Government
description: Chaotic scenes have swept the country ahead of Saturday’s election, amid an acute cash and gasoline shortage — the culmination of a tough eight years for Africa’s biggest economy

title: Godongwana Rules Out Introducing New South African Fiscal Anchor
description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana ruled out introducing a new fiscal anchor in the country’s budget framework as he seeks to contain rising debt.

title: Cambodia Is Investigating Possible Bird Flu Infections in Humans
description: Officials in Cambodia are investigating the possibility that a dozen more people have been infected with avian influenza after an 11-year-old girl died from the disease earlier this week.

title: China Warns Top US Diplomat in Hong Kong Not to Cross Red Lines
description: Beijing has laid down three “red lines” for the top US diplomat in Hong Kong, saying recent comments by the consul general constituted interference.

title: The Moment Vladimir Putin Invaded Ukraine One Year Ago
description: For months, Russian President Vladimir Putin denied he was planning to invade Ukraine. Even as his forces massed on the border in ever-greater numbers, the Kremlin portrayed it as standard exercises.

title: Peru’s Ex-President Wins a Short Reprieve of Extradition From US
description: Peru’s former President Alejandro Toledo was granted a short reprieve on his extradition from the US to Peru, which intends to put him on trial on corruption charges.

title: Musk Trial Win a ‘Non Sequitur’ in Twitter Sitter Case, SEC Says
description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission said Elon Musk is reading too much into his win at a securities fraud trial in San Francisco if he thinks the result has any bearing on his 2018 deal with the agency requiring a Tesla Inc. lawyer to screen his company-related tweets.

title: China Calls for Cease-Fire as War in Ukraine Enters Second Year
description: China called for a cease-fire in Ukraine in a bid to portray itself as a neutral actor that can help end Russia’s yearlong war.

title: McCarthy’s Jan. 6 Video Transfer to Fox News Could Imperil Security, Democrat Says
description: The access House Speaker Kevin McCarthy is giving Tucker Carlson to US Capitol security video surrounding the Jan. 6 insurrection will not enable Republicans to “unwind the truth” of that day’s violence, a senior congressional Democrat said.

title: Lula Intensifies Brazil’s Diplomatic Push for Peace in Ukraine
description: Brazil President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva is intensifying a campaign to mediate an end to Russia’s war in Ukraine as he seeks to reinsert Brazil in the global political stage.

title: US, South Korea Discuss Plans for North Korea Nuclear Attack
description: The US and South Korea held discussions over ways they would respond to possible nuclear attacks by North Korea, which has been steadily building up its capability to deliver a credible atomic strike against the two.
